SEARCH
Package main.java.rintalatuukka.contacts.util

Class TextFile

java.lang.Object
main.java.rintalatuukka.contacts.util.TextFile
public class TextFile extends Object
This class deals with manipulating the contents of the CSV-file that stores contact info. This class contains methods that interpret the data from a CSV-file into a list of Info-object arrays and allows updating specific parts of that list, adding new information to that list and allows the overwriting of the data in that CSV-file with the data stored in the list.
Author:
Tuukka Rintala

  • Constructor Details

    • TextFile

      public TextFile()

  • Method Details

    • openContacts

      public static List<Info[]> openContacts(File contacts)
      This method takes the stored data in the argument, and parses it into a list of Info-object arrays. Firstly the data in CSV-file is stored in a String list. Then that data is parsed into a list of Info-object arrays.
      Parameters:
      contacts - is a File that determines where the contact data is.
      Returns:
      a list of Info-object arrays containing the data from the file.

    • updateFile

      public static List<Info[]> updateFile(File contacts, List<Info[]> contactList)
      This method updates the information of a contact. The user is asked to input the index they wish to update, then each Info- object at the specified index in the list is asked to run a method gets new information from the user. Then the list is overwritten onto the CSV. If there are no contacts in the list an error message is printed instead.
      Parameters:
      contacts - the File storing the contact information.
      contactList - a List containing contact information.
      Returns:
      a list of Info-object arrays containing the updated contact information.

    • appendFile

      public static List<Info[]> appendFile(File contacts, List<Info[]> contactList)
      This method adds an array of contact information to the list. A new array of Info-objects is created, and each object in the array is used to store new information from the user. It is then added to the list and overwritten onto the CSV file.
      Parameters:
      contacts - the File storing the contact information.
      contactList - a List containing contact information.
      Returns:
      a list of Info-object arrays with the added information array.

    • validPath

      public static boolean validPath(String path)
      This method checks if the given filepath can be read and written to. The path is checked to see if it can be read and then if it can be written to, if either is not possible the program returns false, otherwise it returns true.
      Parameters:
      path - a String containing the filepath we wish to examine.
      Returns:
      a boolean telling the program whether the path is read/writeable.

    • saveIntoFile

      public static void saveIntoFile(File contacts, List<Info[]> contactList)
      This method overwrites the data from the list of contact information onto the CSV file. The method first asks the user if they wish to overwrite the data, then deletes the old data. Afterwards each contact in the list is written onto the CSV file on their own line, the information from the Info-objects separated by the SEPARATOR character.
      Parameters:
      contacts - the File storing the contact information.
      contactList - a List containing contact information.
